content: row 2 | p age crochet pattern loveapplecrafts com tunisian purl stitch bring the yarn forward by placing the hook behind the working yarn do this by bringing the yarn under not over top of the hook also called a yarn under insert the hook into the next stitch from right to left letting the working yarn fall in front of this stitch yo and pull up a loop until you get used to this you might have to hold the working yarn down with your left thumb in front of the stitch to keep it out of the way while you move the hook over and in front of the working yarn yo and pull the loop back through from left to right tunisian final stitch the last stitch of each forward pass is worked differently than the rest after working the last normal-looking vertical bar of the row rotate the left edge of the work towards you slightly so you can see the 2 loops of the vs that march up the edge of the work created by the ch1 at the beginning of the return pass insert the hook under both loops of this v yo and pull up a loop as you would for a tunisian simple stitch you are inserting your hook between these 2 loops and the back bump of this ch1 always work the tfs the same way regardless of where you are in the tss/tps repeat all techniques and materials in this pattern are demonstrated in detail in the following video https //youtu be/ccftkue4dws a snail tutorial on the loveapple crafts youtube channel if you just need a quick tutorial on tunisian purl stitch skip the preamble https //youtu be/i-3nvfnplza a lightning tutorial on the loveapple crafts youtube channel 3 | p age crochet pattern loveapplecrafts com honeycomb dishcloths & napkins body of dishcloth napkin instructions are in parentheses foundation with tunisian crochet hook chain 27 napkin - chain 49 row 1 working into the back bumps starting in the 2nd bump from the hook tss 26 napkin - tss 48 27 st on hook napkin 49 return pass yo pull through 1 st on hook ֎ yo pull through 2 st on hook ֎ repeat from ֎ to ֍ until 1 st remains on hook work the return pass in this way at the end of every row the return pass does not count as a row it is considered the 2nd half of each row row 2 skipping the 1st vertical bar on the edge in this & all row tss 1 tps 1 across tfs row 3 tps 1 tss 1 across tfs you should always be working a tps into a tss stitch and vice versa 1 remaining repeat row 2 and 3 until the project is square i suggest 23 row for dishcloth 44 row for napkin 2 end by working a return pass 1 st remains on hook dishcloth optional hanging loop chain 8 attach via
